cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.COM. 

The paper deals with the problem of downlink precoding design in massive MIMO systems, which involves the use of statistical and imperfect instantaneous CSI. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category, which deals with the fundamental limits of communication systems. Additionally, the paper also addresses the issue of mutual interference suppression, which is a common problem in wireless networks and falls under the Networked Systems (cs.NI) sub-category. The use of statistical CSI to avoid pilot-based channel estimation also suggests that the paper may belong to the Signal Processing (cs.SI) sub-category. The fact that the paper deals with massive MIMO systems, which involve a large number of antennas, suggests that it may also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category, which deals with the processing and transmission of multimedia data. Finally, the paper also involves the design of downlink transmission modes, which is a topic that falls under the Computer Communications (cs.COM) sub-category.
